text: [Bob]: I noticed that Alice and Dave were both in the cafeteria doing tasks, which makes me think they might be safe for now, but we should definitely keep an eye on Erin since I saw her doing Fix Wiring, and I'm curious about Charlie's whereabouts during the last round—maybe we should all share what we did to build trust and identify any suspicious behavior.
[Alice]: Bob, you said you saw Erin doing Fix Wiring, but I was with her and Dave in the cafeteria the entire time while we were all doing Fix Wiring together.
[Dave]: Bob, you claimed to see Erin doing Fix Wiring, but Alice and I were with her in the cafeteria the whole time.
[Erin]: Bob, why are you lying about my location, were you trying to frame me for something?

[Bob]: I think it's important for us to clarify our movements—Alice, Dave, and Erin all seem to have a solid alibi, but I still feel uneasy about how quickly they’re defending each other; maybe we should focus on who was around Charlie last before he was found dead.
[Alice]: Bob, stop trying to deflect – you're the only one who hasn't explained where they were when Charlie died, and I saw you kill him.
[Dave]: Bob, you murdered Charlie in the cafeteria, and Alice and I both saw you do it.
[Erin]: Bob, Alice and Dave both confirmed they saw you kill Charlie in the cafeteria, so you're clearly the impostor.

[Bob]: I find it interesting that Alice and Dave are so certain of my guilt, yet they haven’t provided any details about their own actions during the incident—let’s hear their full accounts before jumping to conclusions.
[Alice]: Bob, Dave and I both saw you kill Charlie in the cafeteria, so stop trying to distract us with these pointless questions.

[Dave]: Bob, continuing to question Alice's and my accounts after we both confirmed seeing you kill Charlie is just a desperate attempt to sow doubt; we've been consistent in our statements, and everyone, remember Bob's initial lie about Erin's location, classic impostor behavior.

[Erin]: Bob, your attempts to deflect and cast suspicion on others are failing; Alice, Dave, and I have consistently stated that we were together in the cafeteria, and both Alice and Dave witnessed you kill Charlie.

[Bob]: I find it concerning that Alice and Dave are so quick to accuse me without detailing their own actions during the murder; let's have everyone share their exact movements to ensure we're not overlooking anything crucial, especially since Erin hasn't been scrutinized yet.
[Alice]: Bob, you killed Charlie in the cafeteria, and both Dave and I saw you vent away immediately after.
[Dave]: Bob, you vented right after killing Charlie in the cafeteria, and Alice and I both saw you do it – vote him out.
[Erin]: Bob, you killed Charlie in the cafeteria, Alice and Dave saw you vent, and your attempts to deflect blame only confirm your guilt, so we need to vote you out now.

[Bob]: It's quite telling that Alice and Dave are so focused on my supposed guilt, yet they haven't provided any specifics about their own actions—let's hear their full accounts, especially since Erin's silence could also be a red flag.
[Alice]: Bob, you vented immediately after killing Charlie in the cafeteria, and Dave and I both witnessed it, so stop deflecting and accept the vote.
[Dave]: Bob, we saw you vent after you killed Charlie in the cafeteria, so stop trying to deflect and just admit it.
[Erin]: Bob, your deflection tactics are transparent; Alice and Dave saw you vent after killing Charlie, so vote Bob.
